comment_data.body: Unlike #27137 this only happened once (at the moment), after many hours without such failure.

"Assertion failed: (seen), function unintersect_node, file marktree.c, line 375." 

Same here this only happened once after many hours without failure. In my case this crash occurred after an undo change. 

Neovim commit 1bf645918e94e7e8f770592484164f1ee303f24e

Also happened to me just now - `marktree.c:375`, same as above. For me happened after I opened a previously hidden terminal window. Commit [`e34c23b7016aee5ac6483ab53fed1bce037cec5a`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/e34c23b7016aee5ac6483ab53fed1bce037cec5a)
FWIW I haven't encountered the issue for over a month now. It used happen frequently back then. I am updating neovim regularly, thought it was fixed.

> Also happened to me just now - `marktree.c:375`, same as above. For me happened after I opened a previously hidden terminal window. Commit [`e34c23b7016aee5ac6483ab53fed1bce037cec5a`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/e34c23b7016aee5ac6483ab53fed1bce037cec5a)

ANALYSIS : 

I am not familiar with the code, but since intersect.size == 0, we won't be in the for loop.

It looks that having seen false is valid since having intersect.size == 0 looks valid ( since it happens )
hence I do not quite understand why we have an assert in release here  ? As you see below the case where seen is false is managed by a if. 

I will be in favor to remove it.

for ref in marktree.c
```
static void unintersect_node(MarkTree *b, MTNode *x, uint64_t id, bool strict)
{
  assert(!(id & MARKTREE_END_FLAG));
  bool seen = false;
  size_t i;
  for (i = 0; i < kv_size(x->intersect); i++) { // x->intersect.size == 0 as show in gdb
    if (kv_A(x->intersect, i) < id) {
      continue;
    } else if (kv_A(x->intersect, i) == id) {
      seen = true;
      break;
    } else {  // (kv_A(x->intersect, i) > id)
      break;
    }
  }
  if (strict) {
    assert(seen);  // => crash here , assert is enabled in release, I will be in favor to remove this one, because the if is managing the case below
  }

  if (seen) {
    if (i < kv_size(x->intersect) - 1) {
      memmove(&kv_A(x->intersect, i), &kv_A(x->intersect, i + 1), (kv_size(x->intersect) - i - 1) *
              sizeof(kv_A(x->intersect, i)));
    }
    kv_size(x->intersect)--;
  }
}
```
what is your feeling about it ?

I've recently gotten this error after adding some snippets (and heavily changing my configuration). I've also started to get duplicate completions from blink-cmp.

The assertion is done when `strict` is true, which happens in `marktree_intersect_pair` and `marktree_del_itr`, the latter of which is called in `extmark_del` and `extmark_set`, used in the api, see `:h extmark`, where strict can be passed as an option (defaults to `true`). Both luasnip and blink make use of extmarks extensively.

My understanding from around an hour of looking around is that this is related to the snippet and the completion plugins, and my suspicion is that it comes from a "faulty snippet", as extmarks are used for jump nodes etc. I got this error just after authoring my own (bad) snippets.
can someone send a pr with the change suggested in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/27196#issuecomment-2815633682
@bfredl Yes, that is the correct snippet.
